document_data.name: Quimby's Enchanting Gourmet
document_data.mainbody: '''''Quimby's enchanting gourmet''''' was an [[arcane]] [[conjuration]] and [[summoning]] [[spell]] dedicated to cooking a meal and to cleaning up a kitchen afterwards. It was also a spell of the Servant's Path in the [[paths of power]] system of [[magic]].<ref>{{Cite dragon/216/Paths of Power|46}}<ref>
document_data.Effect:
It was a specialized version of the ''[[unseen servant]]'' spell, producing a magical force capable only of activities related to cooking and other kitchen tasks, such as measuring and cutting ingredients, carrying pots and pans, stirring and turning foodstuffs as they cooked, adding a garnish, and even minding a fire and washing dishes. It was just as strong as an ''unseen servant'' and just as dexterous as the mage who cast it. It appeared within {{SI|40|ft|long=yes}} of the caster and was under their control, but could be left unattended provided it was cooking something the caster had once seen prepared or had prepared themselves, enabling the caster to focus on on other things.

It functioned for at least an hour, or longer according to the caster's capabilities. It could be dispelled by the caster at will or by ''[[dispel magic]]'', or else destroyed by attacking it or by forces that affected the area it was in.
document_data.Components: As well as [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s, the spell required as [[material component]]s a block of wood and some string, and previously a drop of the caster's blood.
document_data.Usage: It was more often used by sedentary or retired [[wizard]]s and sages. Though it was incapable of brewing [[potion]]s or other [[enchanted]] beverages, it was sometimes put to use creating simple [[poison]]s, and once served as a bartender.
document_data.Sources:
A copy of ''Quimby's enchanting gourmet'' could be found in ''[[Jaluster's Orizon]]'', the last traveling [[spellbook]] of the mage [[Jaluster]] (died [[882 DR]]).

The spell was also stored in the ''[[ring of wayfaring]]'', one of the [[Seven Lost Rings of Mhzentul|Seven Lost Rings]] of [[Mhzentul]] ([[1250 DR|1250]]â€“[[1340 DR]]).

This spell was likely one of a number found in the pamphlet [[Volo's Guide to All Things Magical (in Universe)|''Volo's Guide to All Things Magical'']] published in [[1359 DR]], which detailed a number of forgotten spells, and quickly spread to the mages of the world.
